purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the collection of product data elements into layers. It provides for the assignment of representation items to layers and the identification of layers, but does not include generic grouping mechanisms. Whereas this application module specifies the structure for layer assignment, any semantics associated with the use of layers is out of scope.
purpose.example: CAD systems may collect all instances of a given geometric type into a layer, or might use layers to distinguish constructive elements, such as a centre line, from geometric elements that are part of shape definition.
purpose.p: A set of application modules can be combined to provide the capability to assign shape elements to layers and visual attributes, such as colours and curve fonts, to geometric and topological elements. For additional information, see Annex F of ISOTS 10303-1009.

inscope.li: assignment of representation items to layers

outscope.li: specification of semantics associated with the use of layers
